intro: Heterochroa spergulifolia, commonly known as the yellow marsh saxifrage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense inflorescence, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Heterochroa spergulifolia is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland habitats.
